text: does your peanut butter have a pool of
oil on the top don't pour it out it's
actually a good sign of how natural your
peanut butter is all peanut butters in
the US must contain at least 90% peanuts
that other 10% can be more peanuts or it
can be a mix of seasonings and other
oils you can tell the difference just by
how much oil pulls at the top here's why
grinding peanuts releases their oils
it's these oils that make peanut butter
so creamy peanut oil is also a liquid at
room temperature so as the peanut butter
sits and the oil rises and collects at
the top but what if your peanut butter
has no oily pool that's often a sign it
has added oil like cotton seed rape
speed soy bean or palm oil they mix with
the peanut oil preventing any oil at the
top if you prefer all-natural peanut
butter mixing that extra oil back in can
be a mess but pouring it off will leave
you with a dried-out peanut butter so
how do you get rid of it
store it upside down the oil will rise
up to the bottom then just flip it and
spread that delicious goodness
Bon Appetit
